entry.title: Ubuntu package management desmystified
entry.content:
Stats of packages available in apt-cache

~ » apt-cache stats
Total package names: 56184 (1,124 k)
Total package structures: 95540 (5,350 k)
  Normal packages: 65375
  Pure virtual packages: 1143
  Single virtual packages: 8105
  Mixed virtual packages: 1910
  Missing: 19007
Total distinct versions: 71341 (5,137 k)
Total distinct descriptions: 86243 (2,070 k)
Total dependencies: 550600 (15.4 M)
Total ver/file relations: 74796 (1,795 k)
Total Desc/File relations: 86243 (2,070 k)
Total Provides mappings: 15671 (313 k)
Total globbed strings: 378 (4,029 )
Total dependency version space: 2,652 k
Total slack space: 40.2 k
Total space accounted for: 28.1 M

Update the package database (as specified in the /etc/apt/sources.list file)

~ » sudo apt-get update
Ign http://dl.google.com stable InRelease
Hit http://dl.google.com stable Release.gpg
Hit http://dl.google.com stable Release
Ign http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security InRelease
Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy InRelease
Hit http://dl.google.com stable/main amd64 Packages
Get:1 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security Release.gpg [933 B]
Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-updates InRelease
Hit http://dl.google.com stable/main i386 Packages
Ign http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy InRelease
Hit http://mirror.jmu.edu saucy InRelease
Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy InRelease
Get:2 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security Release [49.6 kB]
Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-backports InRelease
Hit http://mirror.jmu.edu saucy/main amd64 Packages
Get:3 http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy Release.gpg [72 B]
Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy InRelease
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy Release.gpg
Hit http://mirror.jmu.edu saucy/main i386 Packages
Get:4 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-updates Release.gpg [933 B]
Hit http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy Release
Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy InRelease
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-backports Release.gpg
Get:5 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/main Sources [38.8 kB]
Hit http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy/main Sources
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy Release
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release.gpg
Ign http://dl.google.com stable/main Translation-en_US
Ign http://dl.google.com stable/main Translation-en
Get:6 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-updates Release [49.6 kB]
Hit http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy/main amd64 Packages
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release.gpg
Get:7 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/restricted Sources [14 B]
Get:8 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/universe Sources [8,397 B]
Hit http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy/main i386 Packages
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release.gpg
Get:9 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/multiverse Sources [692 B]
Get:10 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/main amd64 Packages [106 kB]
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-backports Release
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/main Sources
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/restricted Sources
Ign http://mirror.jmu.edu saucy/main Translation-en_US
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy Release
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/universe Sources
Get:11 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/restricted amd64 Packages [14
B]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/multiverse Sources
Ign http://mirror.jmu.edu saucy/main Translation-en
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy/main amd64 Packages
Get:12 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/universe amd64 Packages [36.3
kB]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/main amd64 Packages
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/restricted amd64 Packages
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy/main i386 Packages
Get:13 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/multiverse amd64 Packages
[1,160 B]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/universe amd64 Packages
Get:14 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/main i386 Packages [105 kB]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/multiverse amd64 Packages
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/main i386 Packages
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy/main amd64 Packages
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/restricted i386 Packages
Get:15 http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/restricted i386 Packages [14
B]

kB]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/universe i386 Packages
Ign http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy/main Translation-en_US
Hit http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy/main i386 Packages
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/multiverse i386 Packages
Ign http://extras.ubuntu.com saucy/main Translation-en

[1,395 B]
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/main Translation-en
Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/multiverse Translation-en

Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/restricted Translation-en

kB]

Ign http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/main Translation-en_US

Ign http://security.ubuntu.com saucy-security/multiverse Translation-en_US

Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net saucy/main Translation-en
Get:25 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-updates/restricted amd64 Packages
[14 B]

kB]

[1,552 B]

B]

kB]

[1,773 B]

Hit http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-updates/multiverse Translation-en

Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/main Translation-en_US
Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/multiverse Translation-en_US

Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy/universe Translation-en_US

Ign http://us.archive.ubuntu.com saucy-backports/universe Translation-en_US
Fetched 1,535 kB in 19s (79.2 kB/s)
Reading package lists... Done

Search the package database for a given keyword

~ » apt-cache search mongodb
python-bson - Python implementation of BSON for MongoDB
python-bson-ext - C-coded extension to the python-bson package
python-celery - async task/job queue based on message passing
python-celery-doc - async task/job queue based on message passing
(Documentation)
python-gridfs - Python implementation of GridFS for MongoDB
python-pymongo - Python interface to the MongoDB document-oriented database
python-pymongo-doc - Python interface to the MongoDB document-oriented
database (documentation)
python-pymongo-ext - C-coded extension to the python-pymongo package
python3-bson - Python3 implementation of BSON for MongoDB
python3-bson-ext - C-coded extension to the python3-bson package
python3-gridfs - Python3 implementation of GridFS for MongoDB
python3-pymongo - Python3 interface to the MongoDB document-oriented database
python3-pymongo-ext - C-coded extension to the python3-pymongo package
falconpl-mongodb - MongoDB bindings for Falcon P.L
libmongo-client-dev - Development files for the alternate C driver for MongoDB
libmongo-client-doc - Documentation for the alternate C driver for MongoDB
libmongo-client0 - Alternate C driver for the MongoDB document-oriented
datastore
libmongo-client0-dbg - Alternate C driver for MongoDB (debugging symbols)
libmongodb-perl - Mongo Driver for Perl
libmongodbx-class-perl - flexible ORM module for MongoDB databases
mongodb - object/document-oriented database (metapackage)
mongodb-clients - object/document-oriented database (client apps)
mongodb-dev - object/document-oriented database (development)
mongodb-server - object/document-oriented database (server package)
php5-mongo - MongoDB database driver
postgresql-9.1-plv8 - Procedural language interface between PostgreSQL and
JavaScript
python-mongoengine - Python Document-Object Mapper for working with MongoDB
python-mongoengine-doc - Python Document-Object Mapper for working with
MongoDB (documentation)
ruby-connection-pool - generic connection pool for ruby
ruby-mongo - Ruby driver for MongoDB
syslog-ng - Next generation system logging daemon (metapackage)
syslog-ng-core - Next generation system logging daemon (core)
syslog-ng-dbg - Next generation system logging daemon (debug symbols)
syslog-ng-mod-json - Next generation system logging daemon (JSON plugin)
syslog-ng-mod-mongodb - Next generation system logging daemon (MongoDB plugin)
syslog-ng-mod-sql - Next generation system logging daemon (SQL plugin)

Installing a package

sudo apt-get install postgresql                                                                                                             nagachaitanya@playgro
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following extra packages will be installed:
  libpq5 postgresql-9.1 postgresql-client-9.1 postgresql-client-common postgresql-common
Suggested packages:
  oidentd ident-server locales-all postgresql-doc-9.1
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  libpq5 postgresql postgresql-9.1 postgresql-client-9.1 postgresql-client-common postgresql-common
0 upgraded, 6 newly installed, 0 to remove and 2 not upgraded.
Need to get 3,428 kB of archives.
After this operation, 14.8 MB of additional disk space will be used.
Do you want to continue [Y/n]? y

Get:6 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ saucy/main postgresql all 9.3+146really9.1+148 [6,402 B]
Fetched 3,428 kB in 11s (296 kB/s)
Preconfiguring packages ...
Selecting previously unselected package libpq5.
(Reading database ... 220304 files and directories currently installed.)

  en_gb

Creating new cluster 9.1/main ...

  data   /var/lib/postgresql/9.1/main
  locale en_US.UTF-8
  port   5432

Setting up postgresql (9.3+146really9.1+148) ...
Processing triggers for libc-bin ...

Download a package without installing

~ » sudo apt-get download mysql-server
Get:1 Downloading mysql-server 5.5.35-0ubuntu0.13.10.2 [11.1 kB]
Fetched 11.1 kB in 0s (50.4 kB/s)

Show info about a package

~ » apt-cache show mongodb
Package: mongodb
Priority: optional
Section: universe/database
Installed-Size: 44
Maintainer: Ubuntu Developers <ubuntu-devel-discuss@lists.ubuntu.com>
Original-Maintainer: Antonin Kral <A.Kral@sh.cvut.cz>
Architecture: amd64
Version: 1:2.4.6-0ubuntu5
Depends: mongodb-dev, mongodb-server (>= 1:2.4.1-2)
Filename: pool/universe/m/mongodb/mongodb_2.4.6-0ubuntu5_amd64.deb
Size: 5290
MD5sum: de1d54bc9a7ea901d79ab86a579aef62
SHA1: 340bddf7c143c8358c2acb9a52e1b46cf2d2e4c2
SHA256: 13697dcab4532eef6bc3a9fccd45a3eb6ccee8e5d39c0bc9a998be8d562215f7
Description-en: object/document-oriented database (metapackage)
MongoDB is a high-performance, open source, schema-free
document-oriented data store that's easy to deploy, manage
and use. It's network accessible, written in C++ and offers
the following features:
.
    * Collection oriented storage - easy storage of object-style data
    * Full index support, including on inner objects
    * Query profiling
    * Replication and fail-over support
    * Efficient storage of binary data including large objects (e.g. videos)
    * Auto-sharding for cloud-level scalability
.
High performance, scalability, and reasonable depth of
functionality are the goals for the project.
.
This is a convenience metapackage that depends on all the mongodb parts:
the server, the clients and the development files (headers and library).
Description-md5: 8fa8c030cb4f008d0ac716b496446f9d
Homepage: http://www.mongodb.org
Description-md5: 8fa8c030cb4f008d0ac716b496446f9d
Bugs: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+filebug
Origin: Ubuntu

Upgrade installed packages

~ » sudo apt-get upgrade
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree

done.

Upgrade to a new release of ubuntu

~ » sudo apt-get dist-upgrade

Remove archived packages in /var/cache/apt/archives

~ » sudo apt-get clean

Remove obsolete packages

~ » sudo apt-get autoclean

Remove a package

~ » sudo apt-get remove postgresql
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer
required:
  libpq5 postgresql-9.1 postgresql-client-9.1 postgresql-client-common
  postgresql-common
  Use 'apt-get autoremove' to remove them.
  The following packages will be REMOVED:
    postgresql
    0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
    After this operation, 70.7 kB disk space will be freed.
    Do you want to continue [Y/n]? y
    (Reading database ... 220711 files and directories currently installed.)
    Removing postgresql ...

Remove a package with config files

~ » sudo apt-get remove --purge postgresql
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
Package 'postgresql' is not installed, so not removed
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer
required:
  libpq5 postgresql-9.1 postgresql-client-9.1 postgresql-client-common
  postgresql-common
  Use 'apt-get autoremove' to remove them.
  0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.

Remove dependencies for a removed package

~ » sudo apt-get autoremove
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following packages will be REMOVED:
  libpq5 postgresql-9.1 postgresql-client-9.1 postgresql-client-common
  postgresql-common
  0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 5 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
  After this operation, 14.8 MB disk space will be freed.
  Do you want to continue [Y/n]? y
  (Reading database ... 220708 files and directories currently installed.)
  Removing postgresql-9.1 ...
  * Stopping PostgreSQL 9.1 database server
    [ OK  ]
    Removing postgresql-client-9.1 ...
    Removing libpq5 ...
    Removing postgresql-common ...
      * No PostgreSQL clusters exist; see "man pg_createcluster"
      Removing 'diversion of /usr/bin/pg_config to
      /usr/bin/pg_config.libpq-dev by postgresql-common'
      Removing postgresql-client-common ...
      Processing triggers for libc-bin ...
      Processing triggers for ureadahead ...
      Processing triggers for man-db ...

Install a package even if the dependencies are unmet

~ » sudo apt-get install -f postgresql

List dependencies of a package

~ » sudo apt-cache depends vim
vim
  Depends: vim-common
  Depends: vim-runtime
  Depends: libacl1
  Depends: libc6
  Depends: libgpm2
  Depends: libpython2.7
  Depends: libselinux1
  Depends: libtinfo5
  Suggests: <ctags>
    exuberant-ctags:i386
    exuberant-ctags
  Suggests: vim-doc
  Suggests: vim-scripts
  Conflicts: vim:i386

List trusted GPG keys for package sources

~ » sudo apt-key list
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg
\--------------------
pub   1024D/437D05B5 2004-09-12
uid                  Ubuntu Archive Automatic Signing Key
<ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>
sub   2048g/79164387 2004-09-12

uid                  Ubuntu CD Image Automatic Signing Key
<cdimage@ubuntu.com>

uid                  Ubuntu Archive Automatic Signing Key (2012)
<ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>

pub   4096R/EFE21092 2012-05-11
uid                  Ubuntu CD Image Automatic Signing Key (2012)
<cdimage@ubuntu.com>

pub   1024D/3E5C1192 2010-09-20
uid                  Ubuntu Extras Archive Automatic Signing Key
<ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>

pub   1024D/7FAC5991 2007-03-08
uid                  Google, Inc. Linux Package Signing Key
<linux-packages-keymaster@google.com>
sub   2048g/C07CB649 2007-03-08

pub   1024D/1BB943DB 2010-02-02
uid                  MariaDB Package Signing Key
<package-signing-key@mariadb.org>
uid                  Daniel Bartholomew (Monty Program signing key)
<dbart@askmonty.org>
sub   4096g/672557E6 2010-02-02

/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d//aaron-haviland-cuda-5_5.gpg
\---------------------------------------------------
pub   1024R/B5D3130B 2009-10-01
uid                  Launchpad havilana

/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d//alexmurray-indicator-sensors.gpg
\--------------------------------------------------------
pub   1024R/2B944FEE 2009-09-28
uid                  Launchpad PPA for Alex Murray

/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d//bitcoin-bitcoin.gpg
\-------------------------------------------
pub   1024R/8842CE5E 2011-10-26
uid                  Launchpad PPA for Bitcoin

List aptitude config (see apt-config -h for more options)

~ » apt-config -v
apt 0.9.9.1~ubuntu1 for amd64 compiled on Sep 11 2013 17:45:29

List all package names

~ » apt-cache pkgnames

entry.title: Generating random passwords
entry.content:
Using apg (see man apg)

~ » apg -M SNCL
5OvDolges]
or{Kneek7
Poos"dres2
ecWopp4of"
Posh[glyd5
5dranKad)

Using /dev/urandom (see man urandom)

~ » cat /dev/urandom | tr -C -d 'A-Za-z0-9!@^*' | fold -w 10 | head -n 1
7!g^eRV7qV

Using pwgen (see man pwgen)

~ » pwgen -s -y -N 1
nR4UH1?@

For more info read this thread on unix.stackexchange

Few examples based on the article below:

Example 1: TRY/THROW/CATCH

Example 2: Multiple CATCH blocks

Example 3: FINALLY block

entry.title: /proc filesystem linux
entry.content:
Max process identifier

cat /proc/sys/kernel/pid_max
32768

Command line arguments of any process

irb(main):001:0> $$
=> 28168

irb(main):002:0> puts File.read("/proc/self/cmdline")
irb
=> nil

irb(main):003:0> puts File.read("/proc/28168/cmdline")
irb
=> nil

Process status

irb(main):001:0> $$
=> 8255

cat /proc/8255/status

Name:   irb
State:  S (sleeping)
Tgid:   8255
Pid:    8255
PPid:   7848
TracerPid:      0
Uid:    1000    1000    1000    1000
Gid:    1000    1000    1000    1000
FDSize: 64
Groups: 4 24 27 30 46 108 124 1000
VmPeak:    48404 kB
VmSize:    48404 kB
VmLck:         0 kB
VmPin:         0 kB
VmHWM:     10980 kB
VmRSS:     10980 kB
VmData:     9452 kB
VmStk:       136 kB
VmExe:      2524 kB
VmLib:      3552 kB
VmPTE:       100 kB
VmSwap:        0 kB
Threads:        2
SigQ:   0/7756
SigPnd: 0000000000000000
ShdPnd: 0000000000000000
SigBlk: 0000000000000000
SigIgn: 0000000000001000
SigCgt: 0000000182006e47
CapInh: 0000000000000000
CapPrm: 0000000000000000
CapEff: 0000000000000000
CapBnd: 0000001fffffffff
Seccomp:        0
Cpus_allowed:   ffffffff,ffffffff
Cpus_allowed_list:      0-63
Mems_allowed:   00000000,00000001
Mems_allowed_list:      0
voluntary_ctxt_switches:        39
nonvoluntary_ctxt_switches:     119

CPU info

cat /proc/cpuinfo

processor       : 0
vendor_id       : AuthenticAMD
cpu family      : 16
model           : 5
model name      : AMD Phenom(tm) II P960 Quad-Core Processor
stepping        : 3
microcode       : 0x10000c8
cpu MHz         : 1795.549
cache size      : 512 KB
fpu             : yes
fpu_exception   : yes
cpuid level     : 5
wp              : yes
flags           : fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca
cmov pat pse36 clflush mmx fxsr sse sse2 syscall nx mmxext fxsr_opt
pdpe1gb rdtscp lm 3dnowext 3dnow constant_tsc rep_good nopl tsc_reliable
nonstop_tsc pni cx16 x2apic popcnt hypervisor lahf_lm extapic cr8_legacy
abm sse4a misalignsse 3dnowprefetch osvw
bogomips        : 3591.09
TLB size        : 1024 4K pages
clflush size    : 64
cache_alignment : 64
address sizes   : 40 bits physical, 48 bits virtual
power management:

Symlink to the original exe

irb(main):001:0> $$
=> 8438

» ls -l /proc/8438/exe
lrwxrwxrwx 1 naruto naruto 0 Jun 10 10:06 /proc/8438/exe -> /usr/local/bin/ruby

Current working directory of the process

» echo $$
8023

» ls -l /proc/8023/cwd
lrwxrwxrwx 1 naruto naruto 0 Jun 10 10:14 /proc/8023/cwd -> /home/naruto/chaitanyav.github.com

Kernel uptime, idle time

cat /proc/uptime
11806673.25 24499.77

Load on the system averaged over 1, 5 and 15 minutes

cat /proc/loadavg
0.02 0.07 0.03 1/226 32569

entry.title: Magic constants in linux/reboot.h
entry.content:
Program part of this repo

#include <stdio.h>
#include <unistd.h>
#include <linux/reboot.h>

int main() {
  printf("MAGIC2 0x%X\n", LINUX_REBOOT_MAGIC2);
  printf("MAGIC2A 0x%X\n", LINUX_REBOOT_MAGIC2A);
  printf("MAGIC2B 0x%X\n", LINUX_REBOOT_MAGIC2B);
  printf("MAGIC2C 0x%X\n", LINUX_REBOOT_MAGIC2C);
  return 0;
}

Output:

MAGIC2 0x28121969
MAGIC2A 0x5121996
MAGIC2B 0x16041998
MAGIC2C 0x20112000

entry.title: Finding glibc version
entry.content:
Program part of this repo

#include <stdio.h>
#include <gnu/libc-version.h>

int main() {

printf("%s", gnu_get_libc_version());
return 0;
}

Output

2.15
